729310f-a.folder: Richmond Avenue & Victory Boulevard, Staten Island, NY
729310f-a.text:
1o3o Richmond Avenue, east side, north of Victory Boalevard. The real estate maps from 1874 to 1917 show the house to have belonged to J. Christopher.
May 19, 1935
P. L. Sperr

729352f-a.folder: Richmond Avenue & Victory Boulevard, Staten Island, NY
729352f-a.text:
Richmond Avenue, at the S.E. corner of Victory Boulevard, showing (center of view) the ruins of the old Bull's Head Tavern of pre-Revolutionary days. It was a tory headquarters during the War of Independence. The view is wrst on the south side of Victory Boulevard.
May 16, 1937
L. Sperr

729353f-a.folder: Richmond Avenue & Victory Boulevard, Staten Island, NY
729353f-a.text:
(1)
Richmond Avenue, at the S.E. corner of
Victory Boulevard, showing the old Bull's Head Tavern, known at one time as the Bull's Head Hotel. It was a tory headquarters during the American Revolution.
May 19, 1932
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A full view of the tavern,seen across Victory
Boulevard.
May 19, 1932
P. L. Sperr
(3)
The same, at a later date.
May 19, 1935
P. L. Sperr

729816f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729816f-a.text:
3119 Victory Boulevard, north side, between Richmond Avenue and Jones Street.  THis old house was owned by the Crocheron family in 1853 and 1874.  In 1898 it was owned by P. Emswinger.  The dates refer to maps on which the owners' names appear.
May 19, 1935
P. L. Sperr
